content:
To access the flag in the HKCU hive of the user 'Purple', you can use the Registry Editor (regedit.exe) on the Windows machine.

1. Log in to the Windows machine as the user 'Purple' using the credentials "Purple:Password".
2. Press the Windows key + R to open the Run dialog box, then type "regedit" and press Enter.
3. In the Registry Editor, navigate to the key HKCU\Software\Offsec
4. Once you have located the key, you should be able to see the value of the flag.

Alternatively, you can also use the command line tool reg.exe to access the value of the flag.

1. Open Command Prompt as an administrator.
2. Type the command "reg query HKCU\Software\Offsec" to retrieve the value of the flag.

Note: HKCU stands for HKEY\_CURRENT\_USER, it refers to the registry hive that contains settings for the currently logged-in user.
